Check for overdispersion in a count time series

Source: R/check_overdispersion.R
check_overdispersion.Rd

This function checks for overdispersion in a univariate count time series using: (1) a Poisson GLM with intercept only, and (2) an optional Poisson GLM with 2-harmonic seasonal Fourier terms based on day-of-year.

Usage

check_overdispersion(
  y,
  date = NULL,
  seasonality = FALSE,
  period = 365,
  print = TRUE
)

Arguments

y

A numeric vector of non-negative integer counts (e.g., cases or deaths).

date

A vector of class Date corresponding to y. Required if seasonality = TRUE.

seasonality

Logical; if TRUE, also fits a GLM with 2-harmonic seasonal terms. Default = FALSE.

period

Integer; seasonal period (default = 365 for daily data).

print

Logical; if TRUE, prints a summary of results. Default = TRUE.

Value

A list with dispersion metrics:

dispersion_ratio

Variance-to-mean ratio

pearson_dispersion_intercept

Pearson statistic for intercept-only model

pearson_dispersion_seasonal

Pearson statistic for seasonal model (if applicable)

overdispersed_intercept

Logical; TRUE if intercept model dispersion > 1.5

overdispersed_seasonal

Logical; TRUE if seasonal model dispersion > 1.5 (if applicable)

n_obs

Number of non-missing observations

Details

Overdispersion is assessed using the Pearson dispersion statistic and the variance-to-mean ratio. If the Pearson statistic exceeds 1.5, the series is flagged as overdispersed.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  check_overdispersion(y = c(0, 2, 1, 0, 1, 3, 2, 0))
  dates <- as.Date("2023-03-01") + 0:13
  cases <- c(0, 1, 2, 0, 2, 4, 3, 1, 0, 5, 2, 3, 1, 0)
  check_overdispersion(y = cases, date = dates, seasonality = TRUE)
} # }
